comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/86.0.4240.75 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce:

I have created a Angular directive for drag and drop, this directive doesn't work with the version 78.2.0 esr but works fine with the other versios of mozilla firefox .


Actual results:

When i drag the content from a table, the drag event itself is not occurring.


Expected results:

Should have triggered drag event when we drag some content.
comments.author: bapuray@stanford.edu
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/86.0.4240.75 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce:

I have created a Angular directive for drag and drop, this directive doesn't work with the version 78.2.0 esr but works fine with the other versios of mozilla firefox .


Actual results:

When i drag the content from a table, the drag event itself is not occurring.


Expected results:

comments.creator: bapuray@stanford.edu

comments.raw_text: As we have seen in the attachment, When we drag a content from table (An angular directive), the drag event is not occurring in 78.2.0 version but the same works with other versions of Mozilla.
comments.creator: bapuray@stanford.edu
comments.text:
Created attachment 9182951
drag_issue.PNG

As we have seen in the attachment, When we drag a content from table (An angular directive), the drag event is not occurring in 78.2.0 version but the same works with other versions of Mozilla.
comments.author: bapuray@stanford.edu

comments.raw_text:
I could not reproduce this issue on Windows 10 x64 and on Mac OS X 10.15, dragged, and dropped examples from https://material.angular.io/cdk/drag-drop/examples using the latest Firefox 78.4.0 esr and the latest Nightly 84.0a1. 

Bapuray, are you still having this issue if you update to the latest available esr version (Firefox 78.4.0 esr)? Also, please can you confirm whether you reproduce this issue using Firefox in safe mode or with a new profile?
http://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-firefox-issues-using-safe-mode
http://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profile-manager-create-and-remove-firefox-profiles
comments.creator: simona.marcu@softvision.com
comments.author: simona.marcu@softvision.com

Closing as Resolved: Incomplete due to no update from the reporter. If anyone can still reproduce this issue, please feel free to reopen the bug.
Thanks!
